result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd B Vassar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Todd B Vassar

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court grants 78 days credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIED. RESTITUTION PAID IN FULL. To be paid to Play it Again Sports.

Apply remaining bail to costs. Court Costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
No contact with Speedway involved in this incident.
Court will grant early termination of probation upon Defendant being accepted into drug treatment program in Milwaukee.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - nonworking hours - STAYED. To be used at Agent's discretion, as to the huber/straight time as well.

supervisions.notes:
STRAIGHT TIME.
Credit for 132 days.
Consecutive to: sentence he is serving in Milwaukee County.
Any costs/fines were converted to civil judgment.

Defendant Todd B Vassar in court, in custody, with attorney John Paul Marchan.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing hearing on revocation. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 6 months jail Straight Time - credit for 132 days - consecutive to sentence defendant is serving in Milwaukee County 
- All fines/costs/restitution previously ordered that remain unpaid shall be converted to a civil judgment.
Dated July 24, 2015 filed by Attorney Marchan advising the Court the Defendant will need to be produced from Milwaukee House of Corrections for the hearing.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Todd B Vassar in court with attorney John Paul Marchan.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed - reading waived.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Withheld sentences for 6 months Probation - 78 days credit if revoked. Sentence may be transferred to Milwaukee County. 
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation - apply balance of bail
- Restitution of $276.00 to be paid to Play it Again Sports - APPLY BAIL TO RESTITUTION FIRST
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation - appy balance of bail
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..  AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. No contact with Speedway involved in this incident. 
 -   10 days jail Condition Time (nonworking hours) STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight Time at discretion of the Agent. 

Court will grant early termination of Probation upon defendant being accepted into drug treatment program in Milwaukee.
